org.svvrl.goal.core
Class Preference

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.Preference
Direct Known Subclasses:
Preference
public class Preference
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains several preferences for the core package.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

stringPropertyNames

public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> stringPropertyNames()
Returns all preference names that have default values.

Returns:
all preference names that have default values

containsPreference

public static boolean containsPreference(java.lang.String name)
Checks if a preference exists.

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
Returns:
true if the preference exists and false otherwise

getPreferenceNames

public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getPreferenceNames()
Returns all preference names that have been set.

Returns:
a set of preference names that have been set

setDefault

public static void setDefault(java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.Object def)
                       throws PreferenceAlreadyExistsException
Sets a default value for a preference.

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
def - the defalut value of the preference
Throws:
PreferenceAlreadyExistsException - if there is already a preference with the same name name

setPreference

public static void setPreference(java.lang.String key,
                                 java.lang.String value)
Sets the value of a preference.

Parameters:
key - the name of the preference
value - the value of the preference, null to remove the preference

getDefault

public static java.lang.String getDefault(java.lang.String name)
Returns the default value of a preference. Throws an exception if the preference is not found, that is, the default value of the preference is not set.

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
Returns:
the value of the preference
Throws:
NoSuchPreferenceException - if the preference is not found

getPreference

public static java.lang.String getPreference(java.lang.String name)
Returns the value of a preference. If the preference is not set, returns the default value. Throws an exception if the preference is not found, that is, both the current value and the default value are not set.

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
Returns:
the value of the preference
Throws:
NoSuchPreferenceException - if the preference is not found

getPreference

public static java.lang.String getPreference(java.lang.String name,
                                             java.lang.String def)
Returns the value of a preference. If the preference is not set, returns the default value. If the preference is not found, return the second argument def.

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
def - the default value of the preference
Returns:
the value of the preference

getDefaultAsBoolean

public static boolean getDefaultAsBoolean(java.lang.String name)
Returns the default value of a preference as a boolean. If the preference is not set, returns the default value. Throws an exception if the preference is not found.

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
Returns:
the value of the preference
Throws:
NoSuchPreferenceException - if the preference is not found

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
Returns:
the value of the preference
Throws:
NoSuchPreferenceException - if the preference is not found

                                             boolean def)

getDefaultAsDouble

public static double getDefaultAsDouble(java.lang.String name)
Returns the default value of a preference as a double precision floating-point number. If the preference is not set, returns the default value. Throws an exception if the preference is not found.

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
Returns:
the value of the preference
Throws:
NoSuchPreferenceException - if the preference is not found

getPreferenceAsDouble

public static double getPreferenceAsDouble(java.lang.String name)
Returns a preference as a double precision floating-point number. If the preference is not set, returns the default value. Throws an exception if the preference is not found.

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
Returns:
the value of the preference
Throws:
NoSuchPreferenceException - if the preference is not found

getPreferenceAsDouble

public static double getPreferenceAsDouble(java.lang.String name,
                                           double def)
Returns a preference as a double precision floating-point number. If the preference is not set, returns the default value. If the preference is not found, returns the second argument def.

Parameters:
name - the name of the preference
def - the default value of the preference
Returns:
the value of the preference

                            java.lang.String value)

                 throws java.io.IOException

                 throws java.io.IOException

                            java.lang.String[] values)

                            java.util.regex.Pattern ptn)

ptn - a pattern recognizing allowed values

Checks some user preferences in the core package to see if the values are valid. Outputs logging messages if there are errors.

toFont

public static java.awt.Font toFont(java.lang.String str)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Converts a string to a font. The string should be in the form "name-style-size" where name is the font name, style includes "bold", "italic", and "plain", and size is the font size.

Parameters:
str - a string that represents a font
Returns:
the font represented by the input string str
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the font represented by str is unavailable

fromFont

Converts a font to a friendly name.

Parameters:
font - the font to be converted
Returns:
a friendly name denotes the input string
